references.paper_title: Multi-scale and High-contrast PDE: from Modelling, to Mathematical Analysis, to Inversion
references.reason: This paper provides the theoretical foundation for understanding the complexities of light-matter interaction in high-contrast photonic devices, a key challenge addressed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Neurolight: A physics-agnostic neural operator enabling parametric photonic device simulation
references.reason: This is the state-of-the-art (SOTA) method that the current work improves upon, making it a crucial comparative reference.

references.paper_title: Fourier neural operator for parametric partial differential equations
references.reason: This foundational paper introduces the Fourier Neural Operator (FNO), a key neural operator architecture upon which many of the methods compared in this paper are based.
This work introduces the factorized Fourier Neural Operator, a more efficient variant of the FNO that addresses some of its limitations, providing another crucial comparison point.

references.paper_title: Adjoint method and inverse design for nonlinear nanophotonic devices
references.reason: This paper details the finite-difference frequency domain (FDFD) method, a widely used numerical technique for solving Maxwell's equations that serves as a baseline for comparison with the proposed machine learning methods.
